intro: Pseudognaphalium hypoleucum var. amoyense, commonly known as the Amoy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern China and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. Its leaves are alternate and usually have a serrated margin, while the inflorescence consists of a compact cluster of composite flowers. It is often found in regions with warm, humid climates and is adapted to thrive in disturbed soils.
